content: BERLIN, May 4 (Reuters) - Two people were killed on Thursday in a train accident in the administrative district of Cologne in Germany's western state of North Rhine-Westphalia, police said.

"Two people are dead," a police spokesperson said. It was too early to say anything about how the accident happened, the spokesperson said, adding that police had no hints that there could have been an attack.An initial investigation indicated that the train had crashed into a group of workers, several local media reported.Five people were wounded, said German tabloid Bild, without citing sources.(Reporting by Kirsti Knolle; editing by Matthias Williams)
